{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=October 2018}} {{Infobox settlement | name = Binika | other_name = Binitpur | nickname = | settlement_type = city | image_skyline = | image_alt = | image_caption = | pushpin_map = India Odisha#India | pushpin_label_position = right | pushpin_map_alt = | pushpin_map_caption = Location in Odisha, India | coordinates = {{coord|21.03|N|83.8|E|display=inline,title}} | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{flag|India}} | subdivision_type1 = [[States and territories of India|State]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Odisha]] | subdivision_type2 = [[List of districts of India|District]] | subdivision_name2 = [[Subarnapur district|Subarnapur]] | established_title = <!-- Established --> | established_date = | founder = Unknown | named_for = | government_type = | governing_body = | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_rank = | area_total_km2 = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = 122 | population_total = 15,765 | population_as_of = 2011 | population_rank = | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = ବିନିକିଆ, Koshali, ସମ୍ବଲପୁରୀଆ | population_footnotes = | demographics_type1 = Languages | demographics1_title1 = Official | demographics1_info1 = [[Odia language|Odia(ଓଡ଼ିଆ)]] | demographics1_title2 = UnOfficial | demographics1_info2 = [[Sambalpuri Language|Sambalpuri(ସମ୍ବଲପୁରୀ)]], [[Sambalpuri language|Kosali]] | timezone1 = [[Indian Standard Time|IST]] | utc_offset1 = +5:30 | postal_code_type = <!-- [[Postal Index Number|PIN]] --> | postal_code = 767019 | area_code = 06654 | area_code_type = Telephone code | registration_plate = OD | website = {{URL|odisha.gov.in}} | footnotes = | official_name = Binika | native_name = Binka }}
'''Binika''' (also known as '''Binka''') is a town and a [[notified area committee|Notified Area Council]] in [[Subarnapur District]] in the state of [[Odisha]], India.
==Geography== Binika is located at {{Coord|21.03|N|83.8|E|}}.<ref>[http://www.fallingrain.com/world/IN/21/Binika.html Falling Rain Genomics, Inc - Binika]</ref> It has an average elevation of 122 metres (400 feet). The city is situated in the bank of river Mahanadi. It is 32 km distance from Sonepur district.
==Demographics== {{As of|2001}} India [[census]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.censusindia.net/results/town.php?stad=A&state5=999|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040616075334/http://www.censusindia.net/results/town.php?stad=A&state5=999|archivedate=2004-06-16|title= Census of India 2001: Data from the 2001 Census, including cities, villages and towns (Provisional)|accessdate=2008-11-01|work= |publisher= Census Commission of India}}</ref> Binika had a population of 14,537. Males constitute 51% of the population and females 49%. Binika has an average literacy rate of 63%, higher than the national average of 59.5%; with male literacy of 75% and female literacy of 50%. 13% of the population is under 6 years of age.
==Education== ===Schools and colleges=== *Binka Boys High School *Binka Girls High School *Siddharth Degree College *Binka Women's College *Saraswati Shishu Vidya Mandir (SSVM) *VABISHYA ENGLISH MEDIUM PUBLIC SCHOOL *Sri Aurobindo Integral Education Center (SAIEC)
==Culture and tradition==
Papakshya Lokmahotsav, the annual cultural manifestation of Binka (Binitpur) was named on the holy place ''PAPAKSHYA GHAT''. The festival showcases the rich art and culture of our region.
==Politics== [[Member of the Legislative Assembly (India)|MLAs]] who represented Binka Assembly Constituency are Padmanav Behera of [[Biju Janata Dal|BJD]] (2009-2014 and 2014-2019), Niranjan Pujari of [[Biju Janata Dal|BJD]], who won the seat in State elections of 2004 and also in 2000. Previous MLAs from this seat include [[Narasingha Mishra]] of [[Janata Dal|JD]] who won this seat in 1995, Chitiaranjan Mishra of [[Indian National Congress|INC]] in 1985, Pradip Hota of INC(I) in 1980, and independent candidate Parakhita Karna in 1977and other Members from Binka for this constituency are Panchanan Mishra 1990, Radhamohan Mishra, Nrusimha Charan Mishra, Baikuntha Nepak, Anantaram Nanda<ref>{{cite web |url = http://archive.eci.gov.in/March2004/pollupd/ac/states/s18/Partycomp113.htm |title = State Elections 2004 - Partywise Comparison for 113-Binka Constituency of Odisha |publisher = Election Commission of India |accessdate = 2008-09-26 }}{{dead link|date=July 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
Binka is part of Bolangir (Lok Sabha constituency).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://archive.eci.gov.in/se2000/background/S18/Orissa_AC_Dist_PC.pdf |title=Assembly Constituencies - Corresponding Districts and Parliamentary Constituencies of Odisha |publisher=Election Commission of India |accessdate=2008-09-26 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090304184320/http://archive.eci.gov.in/se2000/background/S18/Orissa_AC_Dist_PC.pdf |archivedate=2009-03-04 }}</ref>
==Tourism==
*Papakshya Ghat *Kapileswar Temple of Charda *Maa Chandalipat Temple, Adakasa (Pujadunguri)
==Transport==
'''Road Transport'''
Binka is a major marketing hub of [[Subarnapur District]] and is well-connected by roads to all other districts and major cities of [[Odisha]] and [[India]]. The town has a good network of roads for commercial as well as public transportation. '''SH 55''' is the major [[State Highway]] in or through Binka.
'''Nearest Railway Station(s)'''
The Nearest Railway Station from Binka is Barpali Railway Station which is 32 kms from Binka by Road.
'''Nearest Airport(s)'''
The nearest airports are [[Jharsuguda Airport|Veer Surendra Sai Airport]], [[Jharsuguda]] ({{Convert|126|km||abbr=on|disp=comma}}) and [[Swami Vivekananda Airport]], [[Raipur]] ({{Convert|253|km||abbr=on|disp=comma}}) and [[Biju Patnaik International Airport]], [[Bhubaneswar]] ({{Convert|291|km||abbr=on|disp=comma}}).
